title: Leicester Mercury published 5 Leicester Comedy Festival shows that are NOT to be missed
text:
5 Leicester Comedy Festival shows that are NOT to be missed By Leicester Mercury | Posted: December 22, 2016 By Hayley Watson Leicester Comedy Festival 2017 will feature hundreds of events 5 Leicester Comedy Festival shows that are NOT to be missed X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Leicester Comedy Festival is back for 2017 – and this time it's getting political! 
After a year defined by the shocks of Brexit and Trump, the festival have chosen a party theme – inviting the people to "vote for comedy". 
What started out as a student project at De Montfort University 24 years ago has now grown into a major attraction for Leicester, putting the city well and truly on the comedy map. 
This year the 19-day programme will be held from February 8 to 26 across venues including De Montfort Hall, Curve Theatre, and The Y to more local pubs outside of the city limits. 
You can read more about this year's festival here . 
But - with more than 800 scheduled events - it could be a mammoth task choosing what shows to pick. 
So to start you off, we've picked five of the top events that it just wouldn't be funny to miss out on. 1. An Interview with Romesh Ranganathan 
After bursting onto the scene in 2012, former maths teacher Romesh Ranganathan's career has gone from strength to strength. 
He is now a regular on some the UK's favourite comedy programmes including Mock the Week and Live at the Apollo. 
Romesh will be joining Festival Director Geoff Rowe for a conversation about his extraordinary career so far at the Curve Theatre, on Sunday 12 February. Romesh Ranganathan, Curve, £8, tickets here 2. The UK Pun Championships 
Find comedic wordplay really punny ? 
Then make sure you get down to The UK Pun Championships. And be aware it's sold out for the last three years. 
Featuring 8 comics from across the UK, a winner will be decided over 4 rounds of head-to-head punning. 
Catch the competition on Punday (okay, Monday) 13 February. UK Pun Championships, De Montfort Hall, £8-£15, tickets here 3. Jimmy Carr - The Best of, Ultimate, Gold, Greatest Hits Tour 
One of the absolutely biggest names in UK comedy, Jimmy Carr is bringing his latest tour to the Leicester Comedy Festival on Friday 10 February. 
Presenting the very best jokes of his career (and that laugh) into one jam-packed evening, it's no wonder that this show has already sold out – so if you haven't got tickets already, make friends with someone who does! Jimmy Carr, De Montfort Hall, £27.50, sold out 4. Silver Stand up Final 
Think modern comedy is just full of youngsters? 
Watch a shortlist of hilarious comedians aged 55 and over compete live for the Silver Stand Up of the Year Award. 
The competition will be held at PETER Pizzeria, on Thursday 23 February. Silver Stand Up,PETER Pizzeria, £6, tickets here 5. The Leicester Mercury Comedian of the Year 
This prestigious award has a trend of turning winners into household names - and is now in its 23rd year. 
It has been previously won by top acts including Romesh Ranganathan, Josh Widdicombe and Seann Walsh. 
Even Johnny Vegas took the prize back in the '90s! 
So who will it be? You can find out live at The Y on Saturday 25 February. Comedian of the Year, The Y, £16, tickets here
